snippet: Restrictions on when and with whom young people can get behind the wheel are increasingly being enacted in New Jersey and elsewhere.
abstract: More states are placing restrictions on when and with whom teenagers can drive; lawmakers in New Jersey are pushing to require teenage drivers to attach a red decal to their license plates to make it easier for the police to enforce a curfew and passenger restrictions; studies show that teenagers tend to overrate their driving skills and underrate risks on the road.
lead_paragraph: Restrictions on when and with whom young people can get behind the wheel are increasingly being enacted in New Jersey and elsewhere.

headline.seo: Teenage Driving Laws Stiffened in Many States
headline.main: Youth Driving Laws Limit Even the Double Date
headline.print_headline: Youth Driving Laws Limit Even the Double Date
